page.title: 09Service Provision.
page.content: The area has very few services. There are no schools or shops.The only commercial functions are two public houses and a garage/service station.The Farmers Arms public house in Bishops Cleeve is very popular amongst the farming community.The landlord serves a 'good pint'and it's the place to listen to the real Gloucestershire accent.The locals are always served first! The absence of services is partly explained by geography.None of the area coincides with the centre of any of the villages,and improvements in individual mobility has allowed people to travel to larger towns for goods and services.The increase in the number of freezers in homes has allowed families to shop less frequently and to purchase in bulk.
